name: 高淩菁
objective: This course aims to give all IMBA students a sound foundation in the concepts and tools used to guide marketing decisions.  In keeping with its status as a foundation course, this course assumes no prior formal knowledge of marketing.  Because you are all consumers, however, you have a great deal of informal knowledge of marketing as a result of being on the receiving end of marketing actions.  We will try to draw on this informal knowledge as much as possible.
schedule:
Week 1: Course Overview
Week 2: What is Marketing
Week 3: Develop Marketing Strategy and Plan
Week 4: Market Segmentation #1
Week 5: Market Segmentation #2
Week 6: Market Segmentation #3
Week 7: Data-driven marketing decision #1
Week 8: Data-driven marketing decision #2
Week 9: Exam 1
Week 10: Customer choices and decision-making process
Week 11: Business market and organization buying process
               Customer relationship management and customer lifetime value
Week 12: Case 1 presentation
Week 13: Pricing and marketing mathematics 
Week 14: Brand, Product management and new product development 
Week 15: Channel management 
Week 16: Promotion and marketing communication 
Week 17: Case 2 presentation
Week 18: Exam 2
scorePolicy:
20% Case Analysis 1
20% Case Analysis 2
25% Exam 1
25% Exam 2
5%  Class Participation
5%  Intellectual Contribution in Case Analysis
materials: Text: Kolter, Keller, Ang, Leong, and Tan. Marketing Management: An Asian Perspective, 5th ed. NJ: Prentice Hall, 2009.
